Before public schools started around my area, (I heard this on the radio) part of the childrens' school fees at an elementary school included paying for tennis balls (4 of them.) This was not for gym. It was to put on the legs of the desk (like some walkers have) so the desk would not mess up the floor. emoticon_confused 
 Does any part of that seem weird to any one?

post_info.post_title: Stupid, inteligent or just plain odd...

Well if they had the money for it and it didnt effect other finacial areas, why not? Helps keep the floor nice for a longer amount of time.

Lessening wear and tear is a noble idea, but the real question of their "solution"'s worth is the expense of tennis balls over the little felt discs that are sold at the hardware store. I think the discs are cheaper, so they would be the more prudent choice.
 
 
 ...plus, they don't look so dorky.
but woundn't stay on as well, or be noticed when missing.
